SEARCH
Package fang2.sprites

Class PrettyStringSprite

java.lang.Object
fang2.core.Sprite
fang2.sprites.PrettyStringSprite
public class PrettyStringSprite extends Sprite
This class converts text into a sprite. The text can contain multiple lines by putting in newlines. Also, different true type fonts may be used. During development, the fonts may be loaded automatically from the system, but when publishing the game, all fonts used should be copied into the fang2.resources package and should have the extension .ttf In Windows, fonts can typically be found in C:\WINDOWS\Fonts. The files corresponding to the fonts used can be copied into fang2.resources to make sure the target computers are able to properly display the font (since not all computers have the same fonts available by default).

      aspect - true indicates original width and height should be retained, false indicates the text should be resized to fit within a square

    • setMonospaced

      public void setMonospaced(boolean monospaced)
      sets whether this text should be represented with fixed or variable width text. Unlike StringSprite, PrettyStringSprite honors the width of the text as specified in the font. This means that is it not possible to directly set a variable width font as monospaced or vice versa. This method really sets the font to either a monospaced font or a variable width font. Calling this method negates any previous calls to setFont.
      Parameters:
      monospaced - true indicates fixed width text, false means variable width text

    • setFontFamilyName

      Parameters:
